cvar.name: ESCAPE
cvar.summary: A function that will be called to escape shell special characters in command lines. The function should take one argument: the command line string to escape; and should return the escaped command line.

cvar.name: LIBPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for (static) library file names. A default value is set for each platform (posix, win32, os2, etc.), but the value is overridden by individual tools (ar, mslib, sgiar, sunar, tlib, etc.) to reflect the names of the libraries they create.

cvar.name: LIBPREFIXES
cvar.summary: An array of legal prefixes for library file names.

cvar.name: LIBSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for (static) library file names. A default value is set for each platform (posix, win32, os2, etc.), but the value is overridden by individual tools (ar, mslib, sgiar, sunar, tlib, etc.) to reflect the names of the libraries they create.

cvar.name: LIBSUFFIXES
cvar.summary: An array of legal suffixes for library file names.

cvar.name: OBJPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for (static) object file names.

cvar.name: OBJSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for (static) object file names.

cvar.name: PLATFORM
PROGPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for executable file names.

cvar.name: PROGSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for executable file names.

cvar.name: SHELL
SHLIBPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for shared library file names.

cvar.name: SHLIBSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for shared library file names.

cvar.name: SHOBJPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix used for shared object file names.

cvar.name: SHOBJSUFFIX
cvar.summary: The suffix used for shared object file names.

cvar.name: TEMPFILEPREFIX
cvar.summary: The prefix for a temporary file used to execute lines longer than $MAXLINELENGTH. The default is '@'. This may be set for toolchains that use other values, such as '-@' for the diab compiler or '-via' for ARM toolchain.
